page.title: 11PULVERBATCH VILLAGE
page.content: Pulverbatch serves the needs of the south-western corner of the survey area but again is just outside the survey.It has two pubs and a church as well as a village shop. The people of Pulverbatch are very loyal to their area and very much regret the closing of their school and the amalgamation of their church into the parish of Longden and Annscroft. There is a small village nucleus where the pubs are situated and a few houses. The remainder of the village is made up of scattered farm houses throughout the mainly pasture land area. The area is hilly and contains many picturesque walks and magnificent views.
